arts.ttl: 'The last stop': Prospective Reading buyer makes takeover claim ahead of deadline
arts.sum: Wannabe Reading owner Rob Couhig believes he is able to save the club before 'anything truly draconian happens.' The former Wycombe Wanderers chief came close to purchasing the club in August 2024 but the now disqualified Reading owner Dai Yongge opted against his deal. Now being dragged through the courts, Mr Couhig has a case in June whereby he is accusing the club of breaching exclusivity rules while in negotiations with his party. While this is ongoing, Mr Yongge has been given less than a month to sell the club, or the club could risk being suspended by the English Football League. This deadline, of April 22, was already extended from the original deadline of last Thursday.

arts.ttl: Michael Appleton discusses game time for Shrewsbury Town's youngsters
arts.sum: “I know we do well as a club by sending some of the young players out to non-league so they can play men’s football. Shrews have several young players from their youth system training with the first team right now with relegation from League One set to be confirmed.

arts.ttl: Mixed emotions for Shrewsbury Town boss Michael Appleton after Reading loss
arts.sum: “In the second half, they showed a lot of character to get back in the game and scored a good goal. “We spoke before the game and yesterday about getting that first goal and how much it would give everyone a lift from a confidence point of view.

arts.ttl: Reading return to League One play-offs with Shrewsbury Town victory
arts.sum: Reading returned to the League One play-off positions but certainly rode their luck at times, beating bottom side Shrewsbury Town 3-1 at Croud Meadow. Taking the lead through Lewis Wing, Salop impressed for large parts and missed a hatful of chances, unable to claw back any of the 13 points they sit adrift at the foot of the table. Shrewsbury deservedly equalised within three minutes of the restart through Taylor Perry, but Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan scored an impressive solo goal and a combination of Chem Campbell and goalkeeper Jamal Blackman extended the lead in a clash looking nothing like promotion chasers against the table proper-uppers. It did not take long for the pattern of the game to emerge as it was all hands to the defensive pump within four minutes for Reading, although their swift counter resulted in a first attempt on target for Ehibhatiomhan.

arts.ttl: 'We take the result': Reading boss on Shrewsbury Town win and play-off dreams
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt admitted his side were forced to 'emergency defend' a bit much for his liking, but it matters little as his Royals side returned to the top six with a 3-1 win at Shrewsbury Town. Salop are heading for League Two, 13 points adrift of safety in League One, but impressed on the night and missed plenty of chances to do more damage on Reading. However, strikes from Lewis Wing, Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan and a Jamal Blackman own goal did the business. "We take the result," Hunt said at Croud Meadow. "I thought in the second half we were a lot better. We started the game really well in the first 10 minutes and then, credit to Shrewsbury, they came back into it and played some really good football. You can see that the manager has them playing a different style from two months ago when we played them, and we had to try to deal with it. We had to emergency defend a little bit too much for my liking, but we came through it and stuck together. We took control in the second half- the goal was a little bit against the run of play- but it shows the character. We go again and within five minutes we’re back in front.

arts.ttl: Reading move into play-offs after easing past sorry Shrewsbury
arts.sum: Taylor Perry equalised for the hosts before they lost at home to Reading.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to continue play-off fight at bottom side Shrewsbury
arts.sum: Reading are looking to keep up their push for the play-offs as they travel to bottom side Shrewsbury Town this evening. Yet to win against the Shrews since returning to League One, Salop are 13 points adrift at the foot of the division.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Captain comes in from the start in Shrewsbury Town change
arts.sum: Reading captain Andy Yiadom has been drafted in to the starting side against Shrewsbury Town, the only change made by manager Noel Hunt. The Royals need to win in Shropshire at the home of the division's bottom club to keep pace with the play-off race with six matches remaining. Drawing 1-1 in the reverse fixture under Gareth Ainsworth, Michael Appleton has since been drafted in following the departure to Gillingham. Joel Pereira is looking for a second clean sheet in four days after Saturday's 1-0 win over Wycombe Wanderers.

arts.ttl: Dave Edwards: Shrewsbury Town in a painful but necessary process
arts.sum: It's not necessarily an easy watch at the moment, it's not an exciting watch either, but you've got to remember that Michael Appleton's had no time to work with the players and he's trying to overhaul the style of play. But there are some small glimmers of hope from watching the game back and watching how Michael Appleton's trying to play football.

arts.ttl: Peterborough United chief slams 'declining' officiating standards after Reading win
arts.sum: Peterborough United boss Darragh MacAnthony slated referee Adam Herczeg for his performance in Reading's 3-1 victory last week, admitting he had 'never seen a performance like it in 19 years.' The Royals were in scintillating form to complete a first ever league double over Posh in what was an excellent showing of attacking football from both sides. While not knocking the hosts, MacAnthony was scathing about referee Herczeg, particularly for his decision not to award a penalty when Charlie Savage took out Ricky Jade-Jones in the box, which looked like a spot kick from almost anywhere else in the SCL Stadium.
